fillBlock.documentation: A big dispatch that will disallow any other transaction to be included.

setHeapPages.documentation: Set the number of pages in the WebAssembly environment's heap.

setCodeWithoutChecks.documentation: Set the new runtime code without doing any checks of the given `code`.

setChangesTrieConfig.documentation: Set the new changes trie configuration.

killPrefix.documentation: Kill all storage items with a key that starts with the given prefix.

NewMultisig.documentation: A new multisig operation has begun. First param is the account that is approving,  second is the multisig account.

MultisigApproval.documentation: A multisig operation has been approved by someone. First param is the account that is  approving, third is the multisig account.

MultisigExecuted.documentation: A multisig operation has been executed. First param is the account that is  approving, third is the multisig account.

MultisigCancelled.documentation: A multisig operation has been cancelled. First param is the account that is  cancelling, third is the multisig account.

asSub.documentation: Send a call through an indexed pseudonym of the sender.

asMulti.documentation: Register approval for a dispatch to be made from a deterministic composite account if  approved by a total of `threshold - 1` of `other_signatories`.

approveAsMulti.documentation: Register approval for a dispatch to be made from a deterministic composite account if  approved by a total of `threshold - 1` of `other_signatories`.

cancelAsMulti.documentation: Cancel a pre-existing, on-going multisig transaction. Any deposit reserved previously  for this operation will be unreserved on success.

NewAccountIndex.documentation: A new account index was assigned.

BalanceSet.documentation: A balance was set by root (who, free, reserved).

Deposit.documentation: Some amount was deposited (e.g. for transaction fees).

transfer.documentation: Transfer some liquid free balance to another account.

setBalance.documentation: Set the balances of a given account.

forceTransfer.documentation: Exactly as `transfer`, except the origin must be root and the source account may be  specified.

transferKeepAlive.documentation: Same as the [`transfer`] call, but with a check that the transfer will not kill the  origin account.

Reward.documentation: All validators have been rewarded by the first balance; the second is the remainder  from the maximum amount of reward.

Slash.documentation: One validator (and its nominators) has been slashed by the given amount.

OldSlashingReportDiscarded.documentation: An old slashing report from a prior era was discarded because it could  not be processed.

bond.documentation: Take the origin account as a stash and lock up `value` of its balance. `controller` will  be the account that controls it.

bondExtra.documentation: Add some extra amount that have appeared in the stash `free_balance` into the balance up  for staking.

unbond.documentation: Schedule a portion of the stash to be unlocked ready for transfer out after the bond  period ends. If this leaves an amount actively bonded less than  T::Currency::minimum_balance(), then it is increased to the full amount.

withdrawUnbonded.documentation: Remove any unlocked chunks from the `unlocking` queue from our management.

validate.documentation: Declare the desire to validate for the origin controller.

nominate.documentation: Declare the desire to nominate `targets` for the origin controller.

chill.documentation: Declare no desire to either validate or nominate.

setPayee.documentation: (Re-)set the payment target for a controller.

forceNoEras.documentation: Force there to be no new eras indefinitely.

forceNewEra.documentation: Force there to be a new era at the end of the next session. After this, it will be  reset to normal (non-forced) behaviour.

setInvulnerables.documentation: Set the validators who cannot be slashed (if any).

forceUnstake.documentation: Force a current staker to become completely unstaked, immediately.

forceNewEraAlways.documentation: Force there to be a new era at the end of sessions indefinitely.

cancelDeferredSlash.documentation: Cancel enactment of a deferred slash. Can be called by either the root origin or  the `T::SlashCancelOrigin`.  passing the era and indices of the slashes for that era to kill.

rebond.documentation: Rebond a portion of the stash scheduled to be unlocked.

NewSession.documentation: New session has happened. Note that the argument is the session index, not the block  number as the type might suggest.

setKeys.documentation: Sets the session key(s) of the function caller to `keys`.  Allows an account to set its session key prior to becoming a validator.  This doesn't take effect until the next session.

Proposed.documentation: A motion has been proposed by a public account.

Tabled.documentation: A public proposal has been tabled for referendum vote.

ExternalTabled.documentation: An external proposal has been tabled.

Passed.documentation: A proposal has been approved by referendum.

NotPassed.documentation: A proposal has been rejected by referendum.

Delegated.documentation: An account has delegated their vote to another account.

Undelegated.documentation: An account has cancelled a previous delegation operation.

Vetoed.documentation: An external proposal has been vetoed.

PreimageNoted.documentation: A proposal's preimage was noted, and the deposit taken.

PreimageUsed.documentation: A proposal preimage was removed and used (the deposit was returned).

PreimageInvalid.documentation: A proposal could not be executed because its preimage was invalid.

PreimageMissing.documentation: A proposal could not be executed because its preimage was missing.

PreimageReaped.documentation: A registered preimage was removed and the deposit collected by the reaper (last item).

Unlocked.documentation: An account has been unlocked successfully.

propose.documentation: Propose a sensitive action to be taken.

second.documentation: Propose a sensitive action to be taken.

vote.documentation: Vote in a referendum. If `vote.is_aye()`, the vote is to enact the proposal;  otherwise it is a vote to keep the status quo.

proxyVote.documentation: Vote in a referendum on behalf of a stash. If `vote.is_aye()`, the vote is to enact  the proposal; otherwise it is a vote to keep the status quo.

emergencyCancel.documentation: Schedule an emergency cancellation of a referendum. Cannot happen twice to the same  referendum.

externalPropose.documentation: Schedule a referendum to be tabled once it is legal to schedule an external  referendum.

externalProposeMajority.documentation: Schedule a majority-carries referendum to be tabled next once it is legal to schedule  an external referendum.

externalProposeDefault.documentation: Schedule a negative-turnout-bias referendum to be tabled next once it is legal to  schedule an external referendum.

fastTrack.documentation: Schedule the currently externally-proposed majority-carries referendum to be tabled  immediately. If there is no externally-proposed referendum currently, or if there is one  but it is not a majority-carries referendum then it fails.

vetoExternal.documentation: Veto and blacklist the external proposal hash.

cancelQueued.documentation: Cancel a proposal queued for enactment.

setProxy.documentation: Specify a proxy. Called by the stash.

resignProxy.documentation: Clear the proxy. Called by the proxy.

removeProxy.documentation: Clear the proxy. Called by the stash.

clearPublicProposals.documentation: Veto and blacklist the proposal hash. Must be from Root origin.

notePreimage.documentation: Register the preimage for an upcoming proposal. This doesn't require the proposal to be  in the dispatch queue but does require a deposit, returned once enacted.

noteImminentPreimage.documentation: Register the preimage for an upcoming proposal. This requires the proposal to be  in the dispatch queue. No deposit is needed.

reapPreimage.documentation: Remove an expired proposal preimage and collect the deposit.

Proposed.documentation: A motion (given hash) has been proposed (by given account) with a threshold (given  `MemberCount`).

Voted.documentation: A motion (given hash) has been voted on by given account, leaving  a tally (yes votes and no votes given respectively as `MemberCount`).

Approved.documentation: A motion was approved by the required threshold.

Disapproved.documentation: A motion was not approved by the required threshold.

Executed.documentation: A motion was executed; `bool` is true if returned without error.

MemberExecuted.documentation: A single member did some action; `bool` is true if returned without error.

setMembers.documentation: Set the collective's membership manually to `new_members`. Be nice to the chain and  provide it pre-sorted.

execute.documentation: Dispatch a proposal from a member using the `Member` origin.

NewTerm.documentation: A new term with new members. This indicates that enough candidates existed, not that  enough have has been elected. The inner value must be examined for this purpose.

EmptyTerm.documentation: No (or not enough) candidates existed for this round.

MemberKicked.documentation: A member has been removed. This should always be followed by either `NewTerm` ot  `EmptyTerm`.

MemberRenounced.documentation: A member has renounced their candidacy.

VoterReported.documentation: A voter (first element) was reported (byt the second element) with the the report being  successful or not (third element).

vote.documentation: Vote for a set of candidates for the upcoming round of election.

removeVoter.documentation: Remove `origin` as a voter. This removes the lock and returns the bond.

reportDefunctVoter.documentation: Report `target` for being an defunct voter. In case of a valid report, the reporter is  rewarded by the bond amount of `target`. Otherwise, the reporter itself is removed and  their bond is slashed.

renounceCandidacy.documentation: Renounce one's intention to be a candidate for the next election round.

removeMember.documentation: Remove a particular member from the set. This is effective immediately and the bond of  the outgoing member is slashed.

finalHint.documentation: Hint that the author of this block thinks the best finalized  block is the given number.

NewAuthorities.documentation: New authority set has been applied.

Paused.documentation: Current authority set has been paused.

Resumed.documentation: Current authority set has been resumed.

Spending.documentation: We have ended a spend period and will now allocate funds.

Rejected.documentation: A proposal was rejected; funds were slashed.

Burnt.documentation: Some of our funds have been burnt.

Rollover.documentation: Spending has finished; this is the amount that rolls over until next spend.

NewTip.documentation: A new tip suggestion has been opened.

TipClosing.documentation: A tip suggestion has reached threshold and is closing.

TipClosed.documentation: A tip suggestion has been closed.

TipRetracted.documentation: A tip suggestion has been retracted.

proposeSpend.documentation: Put forward a suggestion for spending. A deposit proportional to the value  is reserved and slashed if the proposal is rejected. It is returned once the  proposal is awarded.

rejectProposal.documentation: Reject a proposed spend. The original deposit will be slashed.

approveProposal.documentation: Approve a proposal. At a later time, the proposal will be allocated to the beneficiary  and the original deposit will be returned.

reportAwesome.documentation: Report something `reason` that deserves a tip and claim any eventual the finder's fee.

retractTip.documentation: Retract a prior tip-report from `report_awesome`, and cancel the process of tipping.

tipNew.documentation: Give a tip for something new; no finder's fee will be taken.

tip.documentation: Declare a tip value for an already-open tip.

Transfer.documentation: Transfer happened `from` to `to` with given `value` as part of a `call` or `instantiate`.

Instantiated.documentation: Contract deployed by address at the specified address.

Evicted.documentation: Contract has been evicted and is now in tombstone state.

Restored.documentation: Restoration for a contract has been initiated.

CodeStored.documentation: Code with the specified hash has been stored.

ScheduleUpdated.documentation: Triggered when the current schedule is updated.

Dispatched.documentation: A call was dispatched from the given account. The bool signals whether it was  successful execution or not.

ContractExecution.documentation: An event deposited upon execution of a contract from the account.

updateSchedule.documentation: Updates the schedule for metering contracts.

putCode.documentation: Stores the given binary Wasm code into the chain's storage and returns its `codehash`.  You can instantiate contracts only with stored code.

call.documentation: Makes a call to an account, optionally transferring some balance.

instantiate.documentation: Instantiates a new contract from the `codehash` generated by `put_code`, optionally transferring some balance.

claimSurcharge.documentation: Allows block producers to claim a small reward for evicting a contract. If a block producer  fails to do so, a regular users will be allowed to claim the reward.

IdentitySet.documentation: A name was set or reset (which will remove all judgements).

IdentityCleared.documentation: A name was cleared, and the given balance returned.

IdentityKilled.documentation: A name was removed and the given balance slashed.

JudgementRequested.documentation: A judgement was asked from a registrar.

JudgementGiven.documentation: A judgement was given by a registrar.

addRegistrar.documentation: Add a registrar to the system.

setIdentity.documentation: Set an account's identity information and reserve the appropriate deposit.

setSubs.documentation: Set the sub-accounts of the sender.

clearIdentity.documentation: Clear an account's identity info and all sub-account and return all deposits.

requestJudgement.documentation: Request a judgement from a registrar.

setFee.documentation: Set the fee required for a judgement to be requested from a registrar.

setAccountId.documentation: Change the account associated with a registrar.

setFields.documentation: Set the field information for a registrar.

provideJudgement.documentation: Provide a judgement for an account's identity.

killIdentity.documentation: Remove an account's identity and sub-account information and slash the deposits.

HeartbeatReceived.documentation: A new heartbeat was received from `AuthorityId`

AllGood.documentation: At the end of the session, no offence was committed.

SomeOffline.documentation: At the end of the session, at least once validator was found to be offline.

Offence.documentation: There is an offence reported of the given `kind` happened at the `session_index` and  (kind-specific) time slot. This event is not deposited for duplicate slashes.

NameCleared.documentation: A name was cleared, and the given balance returned.

NameKilled.documentation: A name was removed and the given balance slashed.

setName.documentation: Set an account's name. The name should be a UTF-8-encoded string by convention, though  we don't check it.

clearName.documentation: Clear an account's name and return the deposit. Fails if the account was not named.

killName.documentation: Remove an account's name and take charge of the deposit.

forceName.documentation: Set a third-party account's name with no deposit.

KeyChanged.documentation: The sudoer just switched identity; the old key is supplied.

sudo.documentation: Authenticates the sudo key and dispatches a function call with `Root` origin.

setKey.documentation: Authenticates the current sudo key and sets the given AccountId (`new`) as the new sudo key.

sudoAs.documentation: Authenticates the sudo key and dispatches a function call with `Signed` origin from  a given account.

VestingUpdated.documentation: The amount vested has been updated. This could indicate more funds are available. The  balance given is the amount which is left unvested (and thus locked).

VestingCompleted.documentation: An account (given) has become fully vested. No further vesting can happen.

vest.documentation: Unlock any vested funds of the sender account.

vestOther.documentation: Unlock any vested funds of a `target` account.

CommitStarted.documentation: Emitted when commit stage begins: (ProposalHash, VoteId, CommitEndTime)

VotingStarted.documentation: Emitted when voting begins: (ProposalHash, VoteId, VotingEndTime)

VotingCompleted.documentation: Emitted when voting is completed: (ProposalHash, VoteId, VoteResults)

advanceProposal.documentation: Advance a signaling proposal into the "voting" or "commit" stage.  Can only be performed by the original author of the proposal.

VoteCreated.documentation: new vote (id, creator, type of vote)

VoteAdvanced.documentation: vote stage transition (id, old stage, new stage)

commit.documentation: A function for commit-reveal voting schemes that adds a vote commitment.

reveal.documentation: A function that reveals a vote commitment or serves as the general vote function.
